content.raw: I went ahead and added protection for that.  The time would have to be reinitialized for computing dt in that case.  So there would be one sensor step where the bias doesn’t drift.
content.html: I went ahead and added protection for that. The time would have to be reinitialized for computing dt in that case. So there would be one sensor step where the bias doesn’t drift.

content.raw: Not once this PR gets in: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/429/
content.html: Not once this PR gets in: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/429/

update.description: Use dt \(1/freq\) rather than frequency in the noise calculations.
update.title: Fix IMU noise model dt

content.raw: Actually, are we guaranteeing that update is going to be calling with times monotonically increasing?
content.html: Actually, are we guaranteeing that update is going to be calling with times monotonically increasing?

content.raw:
I was concerned about making the assumption that the first and second call to Update are not zero and zero \+ something.  

In the case that you were e.g. replaying a simulation, the first step would be a non-zero time and the second step would be slightly after that.

I can use a boolean flag to get around that, though.
content.html:
I was concerned about making the assumption that the first and second call to Update are not zero and zero + something.

In the case that you were e.g. replaying a simulation, the first step would be a non-zero time and the second step would be slightly after that.

I can use a boolean flag to get around that, though.

content.raw:
the failing homebrew tests are long-standing and shouldn't block this merge

the windows build should be fixed, since I just merged the sdformat pull request
content.html:

content.raw:
@{557058:65740f22-cc56-4418-9608-7e17d0ed47b7} convinced :gun: @{557058:90bc87b0-2886-4377-a17c-3a6629a697ff} that the new behavior is the correct behavior. They went through the data sheets of some IMUs and compared against the values they were using in the vehicles, and they think the new values are correct.

@{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} can you please review this PR? @{557058:90bc87b0-2886-4377-a17c-3a6629a697ff} will be sending you Fuel changes soon as well. Thanks everyone.

@{557058:5de38267-b118-494c-aa76-4fab35448816} do we need to fix the CI failing tests or can we go ahead with the merge once it has been reviewed and approved?
content.html:
@Michael Carroll convinced @Addisu Z. Taddese that the new behavior is the correct behavior. They went through the data sheets of some IMUs and compared against the values they were using in the vehicles, and they think the new values are correct.

@Louise Poubel @Ian Chen can you please review this PR? @Addisu Z. Taddese will be sending you Fuel changes soon as well. Thanks everyone.

@Steve Peters do we need to fix the CI failing tests or can we go ahead with the merge once it has been reviewed and approved?

content.raw: Actually, I think it should be possible to just use `dt = (_now - this->dataPtr->prevStep).Double();` every time, even when prev is zero, because you're already checking that `dt` is positive in `GaussianNoiseModel::ApplyImpl`, no?
content.html: Actually, I think it should be possible to just use dt = (_now - this->dataPtr->prevStep).Double(); every time, even when prev is zero, because you're already checking that dt is positive in GaussianNoiseModel::ApplyImpl, no?

content.raw: Is this checking if this is the very first update? In case the first update has `_now == 0`, this will be true twice, right? For the 1st and 2nd update calls. Is that what we want? Maybe we can check for the 1st iteration some other way?
content.html: Is this checking if this is the very first update? In case the first update has _now == 0, this will be true twice, right? For the 1st and 2nd update calls. Is that what we want? Maybe we can check for the 1st iteration some other way?
